Review.Contenu: Its cost for us 30 euros to have access to Internet in Mauritius and simply does not work.If we will put money in trash, the result was exactly the same.Very disappointed

Unfortunately, the service availability was poor and pretty much non-existant any time we were indoors or really needed the connection to data. We used this in both central London as well as in the countryside and same issues in all locations. One star for the app being easy to use and the esim videos being helpful for first time esim user.

I used Ubigi at multiple US east coast regions, but the connection was always routed to UK, which caused very bad lag (300ms+ ping). Google's search results were based on location, so all top search results became UK-based. It also caused some other apps to behave abnormally because of the UK location. When I had signal, it was usually weak and speed was slow. I ended up rely mostly on hotel Wifi. I don't recommend Ubigi (at least in the eastern US).

Haven’t even used the service yet and already getting peppered with spam emails asking for reviews, push notifications that are nothing beyond ads, and general service ads. Desperately wish I’d gone with a competitor and day one of use is still three days away.

Review.Titre: I can't login Ubigi, and I passed away from Ubigi.
Review.Contenu: I can't login Ubigi. And, when I requested to send email to remake a new password, "this user has already been registered" popped up. There is nothing I can do to use Ubigi! Finally, I deleted Ubigi app! Bye-bye, forever.

Review.Titre: Bad second experience after a positive first one
Review.Contenu: I just used Ubigi for the US after I previously had a good experience in Japan (I previously gave five stars, but i deleted that review). Unfortunately, I have to give a one star review as they are trying to convince me I used 3GB of US data in less than four hours, despite the app previously indicating I used only 60MB. My US plan overlapped with my Japan plan by one day, so I believe really what happened was both plans expired on the same day. Customer Support told me it was probably due to "5G network overtures" despite my network mode for the Ubigi eSim bring restricted to 4G. And I was doing usual activity that rarely uses up more than 2GB of data in a week on my 5G network in the UK, let alone a few hours! Anyway, thankfully this frustrating experience made me confirm that my UK carrier had a far superior plan for the US than Ubigi anyway, so this ended up being a complete waste of money.

Review.Titre: I had a SIM replacement done by YOU - everything goes wrong
Review.Contenu: I had a SIM replacement done by YOU when I bought a new phone.  I bought topups twice for the SIM through the app, they never showed up. Please refund the two $20 topups and tell me how to kill this problem.
This eSIM doesn’t work. No signal what so ever, and son works for Apple technical support, he can’t even figure it out

Also at the beginning when I touched down in Japan, it said incompatible even though I was using iPhone 12. After 2hours, somehow it worked again and I was able to have an account.

Review.Contenu: The Caribbean eSIM did not work. I lost 14 dollars. Tried many different ways but wasted time and money.

Useless.It work on first day then stop working waste of money and time.

Review.Contenu: The company never responded to my numerous requests for help.  I am now in Morocco.  I paid Ubigi $60 for service here, and I have no service!.

I constantly contacted support for help but they never resolved the issue or offered a refund. Absolutely DO NOT recommend ever buying an esim for Japan unless you only plan to use it for Google maps.

Review.Titre: Date usage is way out of the norm
Review.Contenu: Date usage is way out of the norm. I had to re-up 3x in a 10 day period. I checked my typical data usage with my primary provider and I typically only use a total of 3GB per month. Ubigi stated that I used 10 GB in 10 days. I was careful to connect to Wifi at hotels and restaurants but it still seemed to count any data as used data from Ubigi. I'd like to be refunded but it's not clear how to connect with their team.Response to reply: I was very careful not to watch any videos or conduct activity that would potentially use too much data. Even then, according to Ubigi, I used 3x as much data as I normally do with much more limited activity. Also, each time I was warned that I had exhausted the data, I would purchase a "re-up". Ubigi would not utilize the remaining data from the prior purchase and simply moved onto the next re-up amount leaving unused data on the table.

Rubbish instructions, so unable to renew my subscription. Poor English speaking advisor didn't help.17th Nov updateThank you for your response, to clarify I managed eventually to set up an account but I still don't know how to link with my car ?

Review.Titre: 1-day plan stopped working two times. Support completely unhelpful.
Review.Contenu: Couldn't connect while the plan was still active on a 1-day plan. Purchased another plan while abroad that again was initially working and then stopped. No refund issued despite contacting the support before the first plan end.

Review.Titre: I paid ubigi to work in Mexico
Review.Contenu: I paid ubigi to work in Mexico. It works rarely. It is not at all reliable . It would be nice if you can improve it.I am editing it because you wanted me to mention which streets it worked. The first day I could book Uber and then in the car it stopped working. Then next day I could not even book Uber. So my husband bought local eSIM from At&T. Last year I used ubigi in London and it worked perfect. I wish yo could make it work the same way in Mexico also.

Review.Contenu: The price was not cheap however network was bad in Tokyo Shinjuku area where we stayed and almost non existence in Disneyland. Will be trying Airalo and others in future. Probably those good reviews from others are paid to do so.

The tutorials make you think it is easy but instead you need to modify so many settings in your phone and there is no clear explanation to be found. After more than 4 hours, I finally managed to install the app, create an account but the data package I bought is nowhere to be found so my money is lost. Stay away from Ubigi!

Review.Titre: Seems the app was updated but not the instructions?
Review.Contenu: It looks like the app has been updated but the instruction videos have not, so what I was seeing on my screen (iPhone 12) did not match the video. I had already bought a month’s data package but I just had to abandon that and go with another provider, because I needed to get connected. So I just lost that money. Sorry Ubigi I know lots of people have a great experience with you but I just couldn’t connect.

I was receiving emails for the completion of their data amounts and their credit card info when they purchased more data; I was also sent their 50% off code from the referral. I can never get on to the app to check how much data I have left and it always asks for an email confirmation that doesn’t work because my email has already been used to make an account. Although all of this happened the data itself is a decent speed and connection is good even on a subway.

I had same issue in the past. My conference colleague with competitors installing new eSIM for every country did non have same problem. Tested with roaming on (suggested) and off (the default). Contacted twice web support but no answer in a week even in spam or other inbox (double checked). Transaction id is: SUBI9orR7jYISpq3Dsc9hshu5g

Installed it on my gf’s phone. Downloaded the app on her phone as well. A day later I needed a new eSIM myself. I mistakenly purchased a 10gb top-up from the app, thinking that it would provide a new eSIM QR code that I could scan (this is poorly clarified in the app, but I’ll accept it as my error). I immediately wrote to Ubigi customer support to ask if it was possible to refund the (unused) eSIM, or to transfer it to my phone. No response after THREE WEEKS. However, they’ll quickly respond here. The eSIM works but I recommend Airalo as their customer support is far better. Also, just a tip, avoid using snarky winky faces when replying to customer feedback ;).

My fault, I have got 4 or 5 e sims in the past and 2 haven’t worked. Not sure why, I’m sure its user error during set up but I’m out of pocket and it’s not worth the effort to get the money back. It would be nice if this was easy and obvious to do.

This was a pitiful experience. I have a Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra purchased directly from Samsung, I searched through forums to reconfigure my credentials that were initially inaccurate and that still did not improve my internet. All this while at the same time, my brother having purchased the exact same package was having no issues. How Ubigi can be so painfully unreliable with the eSIMs they distribute and configure. Waste of money. Waste of time. Only stress. Will not be using Ubigi again.

Review.Titre: There is no support, there is no contact info.
Review.Contenu: I signed up for Ubigi service through the Windows Mobile Plans app with a built-in ESIM.  Upon paying for the plan, I was told that I was activated; however, service was horrible.  I could only connect to certain sites, throughput was slow, and connectivity unreliable.  Other providers were working fine.Here's the problem:  There is no support.  There is no support.  There is no support.  There is no email address, no phone number.  There is a form, but you cannot submit the form because it gives you an error message.  You'd think they would notice that they weren't getting support requests, but apparently they do not care.I finally tried to reply to an email from which the payment receipt was sent to ask for a refund.  I received no response.  If you sign up for this service, you are just dumping money in the garbage.  Stay away at all costs.EDIT: You may notice that Ubigi replied to this review and said they would contact me.   They never did.  No contact from them whatsoever.

I used Ubigi for a recent trip to Japan based on good reviews here and elsewhere, specifically for travelers in Japan. I had issues from the start. My phone would always show full bars for Ubigi LTE, but only actually worked intermittently. Sometimes it would drop to 3G, which was more stable, but obviously very slow. Forcing it to 3G was the only way I could make it reliable. This was in the city too where coverage was always good. I reached out to Ubigi through their contact form (the only way I could figure out how to get in touch) and as of a week later, still no reply. Instead of re-upping with Ubigi I used Airalo and so far so good with a connection through Docomo.Edit: I suppose I might have entered my email incorrectly, but I doubt it. It is possible though that the help request never went through since my data connection was so unstable at the time. I don’t know why I had to search their website for the contact form at all when I was already logged into the app. Seems like a help button there with all my details preloaded would’ve avoided all the trouble.

Then got email from our home supplier advising I had used 50% of my data.  Therefore it’s still not working. Relying on bus Wi-Fi for messages. Nothing else works.  Can’t send anything out to Ubigi to get further assistance as nothing works. Ubigi advised wrong sim chosen but can’t find where to change. Finally after nearly a week I will put home SIM card back in phone just so I can use my phone again.  I would really like a refund.

Dear Customer Care,  I changed my phone and I was not able to active Ubigi service on my new phone.  I contacted Customer Cate but I did not get any response up to now. There is very unprofessional approch.

Review.Titre: Don’t use this. It’s a rip off.
Review.Contenu: It’s very expensive for very little product. More data should come with the price I paid. It also doesn’t work in countries listed when I bought it. Overall I feel ripped off. The best signal I have got was weak 3G at best. I’ve had to email customer support so any times I asked for a refund!

Review.Titre: Didn't recieve the card that I paid for and no answers from the client service.
Review.Contenu: A lot of my friends told me good about Ubigi so I purchased a E-Sim card for my travel to Japan. I paid my order but never got the e-mail with the QR-code for the E-Sim card. Seeing this, I tried to contact the client service three times to get this card, an solution or in the worst case, a refund ; I haven't even recieved an answer saying that the case was on resolution or that they got my e-mails.I'm doing right now my trip to Japan, paid but never got the card that I strongly need now.Four of my friends are joining me in 9 days here in Japan and this frustrating experience is not morivating them to purchase from the Ubigi compagny.I write here cause I still have zero answer and I would like to know what can I do ?Thank you for reading.

Review.Titre: Could not get it to work
Review.Contenu: Could not get it to work.  I would log into my account and it would show I paid, there was a Ubigi eSIM on my notebook but would never activate.Gave up, signed up with Gigsky and worked wonderfully.
FAR TOO COMPLEX TO RENEW - IT TOOK AGES!A TECHIE MUST HAVE DESIGNED THE PROCESS, AND HE/SHE SHOULD GET INTO THE REAL WORLD SOMETIME!

Too Expensive!Thanks for the response. I think it’s a create idea but my data doesn’t really work! I’ve been using it and it works sometimes but not always. I’m only using temporarily due to loosing my other sim.

Review.Titre: Didn’t get my free wifi from the free…the fake wifi thing.
Review.Contenu: Didn’t get my free wifi from the free esim with out paying I thought I would get the wifi but no I didn’t… I have to pay for an actual esim qr code..

Review.Titre: Bought this so I could make calls and…
Review.Contenu: Bought this so I could make calls and have proper wifi when overseas. Not great when travelling in foreign countries with no wifi and no way to call anyone. False sense of security. Not impressed
Unable to access my account. I keep getting confirmation codes to my email but they all are rejected for unclear reasons.
Renewed my Land Rover subscription. Annual usage started from that date rather than from the end of my current subscription.

Review.Titre: No LinkedIn or Netflix on Ubigi
Review.Contenu: I had 10gb package however was not able to open LinkedIn or Netflix, really bad experience with Ubigi. For the whole trip I was unable to get into these 2 apps, they were just blocked by Ubigi. My package was for Vietnam where these apps are not forbidden so they have to work.I have not been using VPN, I am talking about the 4G network on my phone, no proxies, no VPNs.
I was unable to connect Ubigi line in most places during my trip, which was very annoying in places where there was no wi-fi. Also initial setup was not easy at all.

Review.Titre: Easy to install but not good performance
Review.Contenu: Easy to install, but many times I had no coverage or it was very bad and slow even though I only used the internet in big cities in Japan
It is not available to access to news sites in Asia through your SIM, and the charge is not attractive at all.

The data service was not consistently high quality. I often had connectivity problems. I also believe the amount of data I was charged did not match my actual usage. Lastly, I believe the app drained my phone’s battery much quicker than should be the case.

Could not start using due to a wrong configuration. The iPad application may not have worked properly. Moreover, when the configuration changes due to the change in place (from one place to another within EU), old configuration remained and caused the trouble in connection.  Not easy to find it. Wasted a lot of time.

Review.Titre: Data only worked in very limited parts…
Review.Contenu: Data only worked in very limited parts of the Island of St. Martin

Review.Titre: If you want data quickly and haven’t…
Review.Contenu: If you want data quickly and haven’t used an eSIM before would not recommend. Was in London and data ran out with two days to go so decided to try this. I purchased at about 6 in the evening. Could not get it to work. Emailed customer service who provided generic response receipt but no advice. At about 10 the next morning received screenshots identical to those in FAQ. I sent my screenshots so could be told what I was doing wrong and received the generic faq advice again. I sent several emails with screenshots of things I was trying and kept getting same responses til I pointed this out and asked if my screenshots had actually been looked at. Next email had pertinent info and finally got data almost 24hrs later. Wasted hours on it ….and if you are in London it also drops out on the tube….where you kind of want it the most to guide you….

It's easy to purchase a plan and it immediately activates without any complicated processes. However, the reception is weak most of the time - I stayed in Boston (MA), Arizona, and Las Vegas. Sending text and photo, calling thru messaging apps, loading a website and google map takes time.

I am in Indonesia- Pekanbaru and Kerinci.  I can connect but the speed is such that I  have not been able to use internet.  My colleagues chose Airalo-working well.  I will test in Malinau this next week. But very disappointed.

Review.Titre: Paid for my subscription before it…
Review.Contenu: Paid for my subscription before it expired . They never renewed it and I kept getting emails saying it was not renewed . Contacted the company but didn’t hear back From them . Phoned them and  they asked for proof of payment so hoping they will sort it now .

Review.Titre: The data usage in UK is quite bad
Review.Contenu: The data usage in UK is quite bad. There is no reception in restaurants usually and on the tube, both under and overground. Not sure why this is so.

Review.Titre: It was great until it wasn’t…
Review.Contenu: It was great until it wasn’t…I went to Japan for three weeks and bought 10GBs…I ran out of data during the last two days of my trip and so I bought an extra 5GBs (first an additional 1GB and then 4more GBs.) Within 5 minutes of purchasing, the data was used up. (No exaggeration.) There is absolutely no way I used 5Gb in 5 minutes. In fact, after losing the 1GB in roughly a minute, I put my phone in low data mode and turned it off completely because I really needed internet access to navigate around Japan. I ended up buying an AirAlo esim which worked as intended. Deeply disappointed with Ubigi. It’s great if you don’t have to buy extra data.

Review.Titre: Disappointed that data was spotty at…
Review.Contenu: Disappointed that data was spotty at various times in Japan. Not a reliable service.

Worked well for the first couple of days in Japan but connection started to get very spotty for the rest of my trip (about a week). The connection was so unreliable that it made it difficult to get around and messages would not always get sent/received. Noticed that there were no issues with connection in Shinjuku but had spotty connection in Ginza, Shibuya, Tsukiji, Nihonbashi, Osaka and Kyoto. Phone is Google Pixel 6

Mobile data just keeping dissapearing and have to reinstall esim (S23U). Have used many different esims during my travels, 1st time this issue. Very very annoying!! And not only me, my son has the same issue with his iphone 11.Never ever will use Ubigi :( This is the warning sign already that you can reinstall your esim max 5 times, usually it is only 1 time. Others allow one time as their service is working and with Ubigi you have to reinstall and reinstall. Hopefully esim will last till my end of vacation 😁 Seriously thinking to buy some other esim.Don't choose Ubigi, many more reliable options are available!
For the asia plan, it was really slow and slow to get service when landing and in airport. It seemed faster after a day or few hours but otherwise had trouble getting fast service

Review.Titre: Worked well when I was in Italy earlier…
Review.Contenu: Worked well when I was in Italy earlier this year but didn't work at all when I was in Mauritius. The Support is horrible and takes ages, even if you have not been able to use it since day 1 you can't get a refund even if the support can't get it to work for you.

Review.Titre: Good mobile connection, bad everything else
Review.Contenu: Mobile service good but too much email spam after purchaseThe app launched on my smartphone in forced landscape tablet mode for some reason and was really hard to use with no option to changeLogin process to app very cumbersome, website design hard to navigate
Worked perfect in Japan, but not at all in Bali Indonesia. wasted our money not being able to get out of our 3 month contract. Ridiculous.
Network isn't consistent. Keeps dropping, even within Tokyo city. No network coverage in Metro at all.

Review.Titre: Ubigi Esim made my phone crash/freeze
Review.Contenu: The Esim connected and gave me 5G data connectivity, but after around 4-5 days of using Ubigi, my phone kept freezing, crashing, and restarting by itself. Basic apps like Maps and Waze no longer worked. As soon as I removed the esim, my phone worked 100% normally again.

Review.Titre: Something went wrong while I was buying…
Review.Contenu: Something went wrong while I was buying the esim. I paid for it twice and somehow it went onto my husband's phone. He was hotspotting for me so that could be why. It never worked on my phone but it worked fine on my husband's He had no issues apart from occasional slow connection

Review.Titre: My first esim purchased there was no…
Review.Contenu: My first esim purchased there was no indication as to when the data was over. I also find it hard to believe that I purchased 10gb if data and it was over within a week when I didn’t use my data for anything except google maps and occasional social media.

Review.Titre: Esim worked just fine as promised when…
Review.Contenu: Esim worked just fine as promised when I landed in Amsterdam, but once in France, even in a major city, stopped working???  Buggy at best.

Review.Titre: Good days plans but the customer…
Review.Contenu: Good days plans but the customer service is almost zero. You have to contact them via a form online and when you contact them they are not helpful at all and just confirms that your data plan is active rather than helping with your problem.

Review.Titre: Very expensive and really bad coverage in France
Review.Contenu: Cons: very expensive compared to other data plans, really bad coverage in France with no network outside of big metro cities.Pros: eSim is easy and quick to set up.
LTE connection keep dropping and have to keep switching on/off for airplane mode to get back on to LTE

The cell/data service is very good, but my data usage was somehow 5x as much as normal. I typically use 2gb over the course of a month, but somehow used an enormous amount in just the first week with Ubigi - despite having the phone in airplane mode for 50% of the time and far less activity during travel.My travelling partner had a different data provider and used their phone 3-400% as much, but consumed less data.It made me disappointed with the value.

Maximum signal with maximum ping. Bought a plan for Japan, but got an IP in Singapore. Download speed ~200kb/s with 5G shown. Frequent disconnection, average 400ms+ ping for mobile games, even in JP server. Well, I chose this cheap price, so I got what was worth this price. Will never reload again. Really bad experience.
The signal is so terrible especially when I use it for google map navigation. The route is keep on recalculating, and we cannot reach to our destination most time.

Review.Titre: Data not working in Miyazaki or…
Review.Contenu: Data not working in Miyazaki or Kumamoto prefecture in Japan. Tried to email Ubigi but never got a response. I got 10 gb plan and have not been able to figure out why data isn’t working after doing all their troubleshooting.

I had problems getting connected, then, once connected, my connection only worked for a short while. I was relying on the data connection for my navigation app, but the connection was so flakey I ended up going with my Canadian cell provider’s overpriced roaming instead. Additionally, the instructions for setup didn’t match what my iPhone 12 Pro Max showed in its menus (it turns out my phone cannot support having two eSIMs active simultaneously).

Review.Titre: Compared to the bytesim esim for japan…
Review.Contenu: Compared to the bytesim esim for japan country, ubigi is too slow even with 5g network. Latency is more than 100+ ms compared to bytesim thats just 25 to 30ms with 4g+ connection with both esims having a bandwidth of 70 t0 150mbps.Also, ubigi is kinda too slow to aquire the signal compared to bytesim.

Review.Titre: I loved it in 2021 but frustrating now & no live help.
Review.Contenu: I loved it in 2021 & found it simple to use, but now I can not reconnect. I keep getting an error when I try to login. The Customer support email said eSim has been deactivated/terminated since it was inactive (not quite 18 months). Advised to delete the eSim and start over, but the app won't let me create a new account. The FAQs and tutorials just send me around and around.

Review.Titre: I accidentally bought a plan for the…
Review.Contenu: I accidentally bought a plan for the wrong country, and there was no warning and they wouldn't let me change it. It took me a long time to figure out what was wrong and then I had to pay for a second plan.

My partner got Ubigi on his phone as well when we were both travelling in Japan. He constantly got 5G and I was on 3G so many times. I have a newer phone too and purchased a higher plan. What the heck?!

Purchased a plan for Burundi, which worked very occasionally and very briefly, even though I only stayed in the capital... Of course we can't expect too much in Burundi, but my friend had a local SIM that worked perfectly well...

Review.Titre: It looks like metering is off
Review.Contenu: It looks like metering is off. I refuse to believe that I went through a gigabyte in a day, as normally I'm good with 5 gigabytes for a whole month, and I didn't do anything differently. The meter in my phone also didn't show such an amount of traffic.

We bought the Japan data plan and it was amazing. Fast connectivity and had very little problems. We then bought the Best Asia plan since we were heading to Korea and Vietnam next. Korea went smooth without a hiccup. Vietnam however, data didn’t work at all. Very, very disappointing and total waste of money.

The cost is quite cheap; however, for us, the coverage was absolutely atrocious when covering distance from Montreal --> Vermont. Was staying in Vermont for a week and I could not get a stable connection for more than 5 minutes. In addition, when connection was established, I never received more than 1 bar.I would NOT recommend Ubigi for anyone travelling this area. I can not comment to other geographic areas.

Data has been very inconsistent. Frequently says I don’t have access to cellular data. Cannot make calls and texts are completely inconsistent. Sometimes I can send messages and sometimes says I don’t have cellular. Cannot use the App Store at all. Waste of money and wish I used another company.

Review.Titre: We were having issues after setup
Review.Contenu: We were having issues after setup. I sent an email requesting clarification but never received a response. Poor customer support. If you just put a video showing setup, instead of writing directions (which I think is missing a step), would be more helpful.

Review.Titre: Americas good SE Asia not so good
Review.Contenu: So I have used Ubigi in the US and South America and it worked well.  Recently did a trip to Indonesia, Sumatra, Vietnam, and Singapore and the coverage was horrible.

ubigi worked fine for 4 days and ever since has been nearly unusable. Even when I have full bars LTE service i can do nothing more than receive text messages. I can’t send texts or use Maps. I’ll change this rating if the company fixes the issue but I’m all fed up, this is worse than having nothing because I expect it to work and then nothing happens.

Was told I could change the dates of my roaming plan. I couldn’t. After I signed up and my first plan expired there was no weekly plan option. The app doesn’t let me use face recognition or even store my user name.

Review.Titre: App is 90% of the time not woeking
Review.Contenu: Setting up the E-Sim is easy but 90% of the time the app is not working and if you are lucky it works after 10-15 times refreshing.Has nothing to do with the network as all other apps and websites work well

Review.Titre: Not good for Text Messages; No Voice Calls
Review.Contenu: Internet usage was, generally, OK but text messages received and sent over Ubigi's data were delivered so far after they should have been. No voice calls would work. Definitely needs an improvement.

Review.Titre: My first data package was consumed in…
Review.Contenu: My first data package was consumed in few hours - probably because my phone stayed on. Then I bought a Asian package in which Taiwan was not in while I was staying in taiwan, then I bought an expensive package.All in all because the explanation were less than clear. I ended up paying like 80 USD while I could have paid easily half of it.

Review.Titre: Most of the time the internet is not…
Review.Contenu: Most of the time the internet is not working, it suddenly change from Ubigi to Simba.

While traveling to Israel I've had coverage with Ubigi, but the speed was horrible, despite being on the "LTE" network. Browsing the net was barely possible, sending WhatsApp messages took _minutes_ even if the message was text-only.

Often had 1 bar or no connectivity in the UK where UK natives had full strength signal on networks such as O2. This was frustrating and we often had to resort to paid wifi for connectivity. When we had Ubigi connectivity though, it was fine.

Google Pixel 6a, with Ubigi eSIM.Most of the time the internet connectivity was not working AT ALL, even in the urban area (Sarajevo, the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina). Outside of urban area, the internet connection was even worse and I needed it for Google Maps navigation. It started working all of the sudden, where I didn't even expect it to work at all (in the part of the country far from any urban settlement). This is the first time I had so bad experience with Ubigi eSIM, usually it works perfectly well.

Review.Titre: Customer Service did not respond correctly
Review.Contenu: Customer Service did not respond to the question asked. They did provide information related to, but not about, the questions asked.I used short sentences assuming non-English respondent.Not important enough to pursue.

Unable to get LTE service in St. Lucia or St. Vincent using iPhone XS MaxI was in St. Lucia from 29 March to 16 April 2023. Traveled between Vieux Fort, Soufriere, Gros Islet and Rodney Bay.Stayed in St. Vincent from 6 to 11 August 2023 and traveled between Young Island and Kingstown.It is hoped that the above is helpful.

The instruction video did not play on the website, so it was unclear how the process works. It took time for the service to turn on even after following the instructions. After the service kicked in, my favorites and my guides that previously existed on the iPhone completely disappeared, and Ubigi customer service said they don’t know how to help. Messages (SMS) did not work over Ubigi, and when consulted, the customer service said I needed to use my primary mobile/cellular service for it, which defeats the purpose of purchasing eSim.

Review.Titre: There are no tips on how to setup the…
Review.Contenu: There are no tips on how to setup the phone to not waste data and after the data is almost gone we found much cheaper options, your pricing is far off the market

Review.Titre: There is no 5G connection at all when i…
Review.Contenu: There is no 5G connection at all when i was in japan for previous 3 weeks..i used docomo network and within tokyo but still no 5G connection as claimed..

Review.Titre: Data package in Europe and Brazil…
Review.Contenu: Data package in Europe and Brazil worked perfectly, but in Caribbean, it was so slow. I asked for refund but was refused. Wasted $.

Review.Titre: All worked well in Harare but no…
Review.Contenu: All worked well in Harare but no connection in Kwekwe. Contacted support desk but they could not help in this case.

Review.Titre: Paid for 5g and didn't get it. Suspicious connection speeds
Review.Contenu: I paid for 5g in japan and haven't got it the whole time I've been here. I've been travelling and staying in CBD Tokyo and Sapporo and have been constantly looking for a 5g connection while moving around. The 5g zones on DoCoMo website cover all of these two cities so it's totally suspicious that I can't get it. Other reviews claim good 4g but didn't see any 5g. I've got 5g preferred set on my mobile connection settings, I've attempted to manually set the service provider but DoCoMo isn't an option to choose and KDDI can't be selected. Ubigi is the only option. It's supposed to automatically connect to the DoCoMo network when selected but sometimes it's a horrible connection. I looked at where my IP was and somehow it's often coming from France. Don't get me wrong, if I paid for 4g then I'd be totally happy with the service. While the 4g lte is fine most of the time sometimes it's absolutely trash and I need it to work because I'm working remotely.I bought 5g and expected to do some cloud gaming but the connection is no where good enough.I've got a Galaxy Fold 3.-- edit: I've contacted them with the info they've requested, waiting to hear back --

Service was acceptable and customer service care was not very good when I needed support. Setup was a pain. Only benefit to the service was the low cost, but otherwise I would recommend others to go elsewhere for a better overall experience.

Very difficult to get working no notes on what to make sure is active on your phone so it can start working. When it asks you to scan a QR code on your phone how are you meant to do that. No codes to type in instead. Felt very stressed with it. My mums had constant problems trying to get it running.
Signal drops frequently. Sometimes I was stuck with 3g.I experienced this in Nagoya and Tokyo in the last week

Review.Titre: On several occasions I had no reception…
Review.Contenu: On several occasions I had no reception at all and wasn’t available.Edit: cellular reception was awful (my phone was unavailable several times a day) in Disneyland Paris 23-26.5. Hope this helps.

Review.Titre: Took a subscription for the UK…
Review.Contenu: Took a subscription for the UK 30days,my 4G was not working well and i struggled alot with it, price was okay but the rest was meh.
Original data plan was significantly slower than competitors my friends chose and after buying the data top up the esim didn't recognize the purchase and stopped working

Review.Titre: The connection quality is horrific at…
Review.Contenu: The connection quality is horrific at the most random times. I was downtown Tokyo with full bars and the thing just refused to access the internet.

Review.Titre: Did not know vpn should be turned off…
Review.Contenu: Did not know vpn should be turned off halfway through the trip to use the app. Found out by accident. Besides that the app works fine.
Almost unusable in Disney Japan.  It has strong signal but data rate is less than 1MB/s.   Possible due to low prioritization compare to other providers.

Review.Titre: I cannot check the usage from the app
Review.Contenu: I cannot check the usage from the app. When I try to login I get an error with the text ERROR…please try again. The same login works fine on the internet portal.

Review.Titre: I was logged out of the app numerous…
Review.Contenu: I was logged out of the app numerous and left stranded without data (and since it logged me out, i had to find a wifi source to log back in)

Review.Titre: Bought a USD10 1 month 3GB code and…
Review.Contenu: Bought a USD10 1 month 3GB code and could not apply it. Just to test I then bought a 2Eur 1 day and that worked fine.

Review.Titre: Ubigi does not work in Slovakia as advertised
Review.Contenu: I paid for a 3gig plan to use in East Europe that includes Poland, Austria and Slovakia, but I could not use Ubigi in Brastisalava, Slovakia as advertised.
Was using Ubigi in Morocco. I had the internet connection at all times but very very slow. It showed 4G, but was more like 3G

Review.Titre: Network connection is weak in some…
Review.Contenu: Network connection is weak in some areas. Quite disappointed.
Even though the phone connected to a LTE network, the speeds were very bad and most of the times it just didn’t work

Review.Titre: I could not get support to get back to…
Review.Contenu: I could not get support to get back to me on business question and activating more than one laptop.
was supposed to be a 5G connection but finally I got only LTE :-(
Worked in UK, but I bought a package specifically for South Africa that didn’t work at all.

Review.Titre: Data is very very slow in congested areas
Review.Contenu: Data is very very slow in congested areas. The only issue with that is Japan is all congested areas

Review.Titre: I do not want my personal details…
Review.Contenu: I do not want my personal details shared with 3rd parties like TrustPilot
In Karuizawa, the cellular network doesn't work, even though the signal appears to be very strong.
Difficulty in texting. Couldn’t text in iMessage or otherwise reliably. Even after making the appropriate changes to the cellular setting

Review.Titre: Messages from LINE were very slow to…
Review.Contenu: Messages from LINE were very slow to come through and calls on LINE simply didn't connect.

The service is 5G but its 90mbps and sometimes 20mbps! But its cheap 8€ 3GB so I bought it for 5G (500mbps) bc My plan is 4G 17€/Month unlimited and it was 70-120mbps! Sometimes the 5G got to 300mbps but rarely!
Intermittent connection in Osaka and Tokyo. Connection switches between 5G and LTE frequently

Review.Titre: Worked find then not at all
Review.Contenu: It worked for 3 days in France and then stopped working for 4 days straight. Not very happy.
I purchased mine , it said it was activated.But I couldn’t get it to work in Bali .Wont be buying again .🥲
No 5G, poor signal, low bandwidth consistently in mexico city.
Purchased Japan Ubigi Plan. Very poor and totally no reception indoor. Unable to make call via social media such as whatapps easily.

Despite being at locations with good connectivity, I kept losing network/data connectivity on Ubigi every now and then. There was this one time when I was walking around in Shibuya and everything was working fine and then I lost connectivity. It took 20-25 for me to be able to connect back to the internet on Ubigi. You might as well consider getting a data-only SIM in Japan.
Unreliable connection in Japan, Connect drops occur daily and needed when navigating using google maps
In Tokyo, full bars, but no data connections for periods of time. Haven’t used 3 GB of a 10 GB plan. What gives?

Review.Titre: When I talk to people with LINE without…
Review.Contenu: When I talk to people with LINE without LINE, it is not easy to hear their voice.
Internet was very inconsistent. Will not be using the service again
Good value, spotty and slow connection though

Review.Titre: I was not getting very good speed at…
Review.Contenu: I was not getting very good speed at all while I was connected at Fort Dent in Tukwila, WA. Set up and billing were fairly straightforward.

Review.Titre: I spent quite a bit of time setting up…
Review.Contenu: I spent quite a bit of time setting up Ubigi in advance of a trip to Europe. After a few hours spent setting it up and thinking I was good to go, I arrived in Portugal and could not activate the internet. I went to a Vodaphone store to ask for help. They were also not successful. I therefore had to purchase a SIM card, an added expense. I wish it had worked for me but based on my experience I cannot recommend Ubigi.

Review.Titre: Rather cheap but connection was quite…
Review.Contenu: Rather cheap but connection was quite slow around Tokyo area.

Review.Titre: New eSIM on a new phone but old account issues
Review.Contenu: Had to setup a new eSIM on a new phone.After I did that, when I went to create an account and logged in with my old information, the new eSIM didn’t report under the account.Took a while to get it reported that somehow some application consumed all the data. When I purchased a new eSIM, it had issues initializing and I spent 2 days trying to troubleshoot with little support.The whole process could be handled better by Ubigi.

Review.Titre: Did not work due to overlapping plans
Review.Contenu: Bought Asia plan prior to going to Nepal. It has not worked. Updating this as now working. Seems it is important not to buy overlapping plans as you get stuck on the first one.
Like: easy to activate. Works immediately on arrival.Dislike: connection can be unreliable and slow at times. There were times when I can’t load anything despite having full bars 5G.
Have had no issues with data service but no lower cost small data plans e.g. 0.5Gb pm.Insufficient e-support service provides limited if not unhelpful advice.Is it AI rather than human?

Data usage is more than what my phone is saying. The app says I have 1.09GB left out of 3GB but my phone is only showing 1.65GB of usage. That's more than 350MB missing and this gap continues to widen as I keep monitoring it. It is pretty reliable though

Used Ubigi for my 2 previous Japan trips earlier this year and had no issues with it. Decided on it again this time round and pleasantly surprised with the 50% discount code applied upon checked out. However service this time round was undesirable - there were frequent drops in coverage even in the city. If the discount equates to such service, I would rather not have the discount.

Review.Titre: In Thailand I consistently only got 3G…
Review.Contenu: In Thailand I consistently only got 3G service. A bit overpriced but convenient. Note: essentially 3G service ONLY throughout all of Bangkok (major city!)  regardless of geographic location or being indoors vs outdoors. I Rarely had anything better than 3G service, compared to my co travelers using a different e-sim service who consistently had 4G/5G while in the same location as me.

Review.Titre: After two years I still struggle with…
Review.Contenu: After two years I still struggle with how Ubigi relates to Jaguar and my iPhone and what exactly Jaguar in-control is.

Review.Titre: Issues using e-SIM for Grab in SGP
Review.Contenu: In SGP - Grab (SE Asia Uber) often didn’t work with the e-SIM. WhatsApp and internet were fine but I usually needed to connect to wifi to order a car and could not check progress during the journey. Not a showstopper but irritating. When I was leaving I was in a bar and needed to get a hotspot from a friend to order the car and then my friend needed to come with me to the pick-up spot so that I could stay connected (as traffic jams delayed the driver’s arrival)
The network gets cut off when reaches certain part of Japan when I was in the Shinkansen. Even when travelling on the bus, the network wasn’t very stable too.

•Liked that could load BEFORE leaving home•Did NOT like that Ubigi didn’t automatically load the TopUp•was locked out because couldn’t remember Password •didn’t automatically update from e-mail•lost $8.00 because of this

Review.Titre: It can do the job for internet connectivity
Review.Contenu: It provides good Internet connectivity service. It has no issue with emailing, mapping, browsing on internet but I don’t know why my Instagram and Facebook weren’t working properly. I could not get any text message neither. The WhatsApp was working fine though.

Review.Titre: Was in Thailand and it took hours to…
Review.Contenu: Was in Thailand and it took hours to get up and running

Spotty connection throughout Tokyo. Hakone and Yokohama is decent. Often need to toggle airplane mode for it to work again. Customer service is slow to respond to my complaint. Connection speed is nothing to shout about.

Review.Titre: Impossible for the phone to scan the QR code inside the Ubigi email received on the same phone !
Review.Contenu: I have a perfectly eSIM compatible iPhone 13 Pro Max and after purchasing the Ubigi eSIM I received an activation QR code by email on the phone which I could not scan with my phone. I had to forward the email to another phone to be able to scan it with my phone. I lost 4 days of usage out of my 7 days holiday trying to figure out why I had no mobile data access on my existing Ubigi eSIM. Not pleasant.

Review.Titre: The 5G is not stable at Tokyo
Review.Contenu: The 5G is not stable at Tokyo. Often not able to load and need to wait for a while. Switch off the auto 5G and use LTE does not help. Perhaps ubigi can work with their telco partner to improve this.
Good service, fast delivery of everything. But the amount doesn't last the duration. This needs to be made clear. I thought the GB/MB would renew everyday. But they don't.

Review.Titre: Referral program comes with expiry date…
Review.Contenu: Referral program comes with expiry date which does not make sense. No point giving out twenty 50% discount code but all have to be consume within 6 months. For comparision, Airalo's referral program does not have an expiry date.

Deserved 5* but unfortunately there are dead zones when using Ubigi. Lost connection when roaming in Kyoto, Tokyo Disneyland. Had to restart the phone multiple times to reinstate connection Otherwise, connection was very smooth the rest of the time
Pretty much every country I've used Ubigi at has had signal problems in absurd places like in the middle of the city somewhere. I'm looking to try a different service...

Bought the esim for japan, it was working smoothly most of the time. Stopped getting data service one morning and I emailed customer support. There was no response or any help provided. Esim started working again on its own after a while but had to buy a new esim from another provider in the interim.

Review.Titre: I need to always make my iphone in…
Review.Contenu: I need to always make my iphone in airplane and online again to make the internet works.. and the whatsapp, cannot call immediately, the recipient does not notice that she is being called

Review.Titre: There is still room for improvementMore payment options would be…
Review.Contenu: More payment options would be beneficial. Why not PayPal possible? Not everyone has a credit card or similar. The price/performance ratio could be better.

Average service coverage and speed eventhough i'm on 5G. This was in the span of 13 days in my trip to Japan in major cities - Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto. I was on a 10GB/30 days plan and even topped up another 10GB on my 10th day.

Like:1. Easy to signup, then get up and running.2. Good (not excellent) coverage using their chosen provider, but I wish we could have an alternative option where coverage is weak.Dislike:1. I would like to top-off in 1GB increments, rather than in 3GB increments.2. Their app is unnecessary.

Review.Titre: The Ubigi portal and customer support
Review.Contenu: The Ubigi portal - website and on the app was very buggy and made it difficult to purchase a plan.  I had to try more than 7 times to finally get connected.The instructions are not the same as the actual process to finally get access.  I tried to purchase online but it never went through.  I had to use the app to purchase my plan.  I was not able to setup my ESIM until I got to the location.Lastly, trying to contact someone for assistance was very difficult.  I tried to use the online form, but it never allowed my submit my issue.  The form kept saying that there is something missing or incorrect.  Also, there is NO phone number that I could use to get help.  There needs to customer support that is easy to contact.

Review.Titre: went great for 7 days then refused to…
Review.Contenu: went great for 7 days then refused to work. was stock in germany and needed internet so i bought a sim card like i used to do and everything went find for me after.i informed ubiji of the situation they responded a few hours later and asked to verify some items   but i could not wait since did not know how fast they would respond and needed internet to pursuit my trip in Europe
Basic LTE service-level in Japan, but has a relatively slow and unstable connection quality overall.It has the merit of being affordable at least!
Easy installation, price is good, but coverage (in metropolitan Tokyo) is strongly average. Lost all signal multiple times while in the middle of large open spaces

Review.Titre: Setup instruction was outdated. Hard to set up but internet experience good!
Review.Contenu: the setup was not as easy as shown in the instruction. Didnt work at all on s23 ultra and galaxy fold 4 on the first day of activating the service. have to do extensive researc on reddit. It turned out Roaming must be enabled to begin the service. Setup instruction was outdated.After everything was set up, the internet experience was very smooth.

Review.Titre: connection was bad or non existent…
Review.Contenu: connection was bad or non existent sometimes. not reliable

Review.Titre: Convenient but a battery power hog
Review.Contenu: Love the convenience of initiating service before arriving in country. Setup was straightforward. The value is excellent. BUT it chews up my iPhone battery power. This is unfortunate for a fundamental travel app. When travelling one relies on the smart phone for mapping, reference, photos, etc. But when I have the Ubigi eSim enabled, my battery power is severely depleted. I hope you can make the app more efficient,

Review.Titre: Convenient but a battery power hog
Review.Contenu: Love the convenience of initiating service before arriving in country. Setup was straightforward. The value is excellent. BUT it chews up my iPhone battery power. This is unfortunate for a fundamental travel app. When travelling one relies on the smart phone for mapping, reference, photos, etc. But when I have the Ubigi eSim enabled, my battery power is severely depleted. I hope you can make the app more efficient,

Review.Titre: Strong and stable network, but not easy to set up
Review.Contenu: I bought for my trip to Japan. The network was very good, most time it was 5G while I was in Japan. However, the setup was very difficult. I setup my phone a day before my travel. I got errors constantly after I scanned the QR code that was given in the email.  Then I tried the second day which was a few hours before I got on the airplane. I got a different error that said my QR code was invalid. I had to call the customs service. I did not know what they did, they told me I joined the network. Indeed, I could see Ubigi in my phone's cell carriers. I almost gave up Ugigi to buy another service that my friend told me.

Review.Titre: At Osaka KIX airport I did not pick up…
Review.Contenu: No signal acquired when I landed at Osaka KIX airport, it made needed travel coordination difficult.  I had to turn on my cellular data from my carrier to get myself out of the airport.  However, once in the city of Osaka, the Ubigi signal worked fine.

Service is good. Is a little bit hard to setup, but overall easy to use. I got some issue with the auto selection of the provider, leading to « not connected to Internet », which is annoying. By default LTE seems to be the preferred network, rather that 5G, is this intentional? I’ve bought too much data for my stay, which is a waste of money. I would like to be able to trade-in for later usage or another formula to not trash euro like I did.

Review.Titre: After crossing into Italy from France…
Review.Contenu: After crossing into Italy from France my connection died.  When I returned to France, I couldn’t get the connection back.  Although I had 9 GB and 25 days left on my plan, I had to buy a top up (3 GB) in order to regain connection.  Also, mostly could not get service in eastern Côte d’Azur.

When assistance was required submitting the problem I had was not very easy Then i didn’t get help for the problem until many hours later close to 24hrsMaybe inform about the time frame you will come back with the assistance so it’s more clearThanks

Review.Titre: 3/5 score even if the stars don't save
Review.Contenu: Hmm weird, I am trying to give 3 stars but it changes back to 5 whenever I click on the box.My review is in two parts: Vietnam coverage and Japan coverage.For Vietnam, it's a 1/5. Service would cut in and out for no noticeable reason, even when I was sitting in one place. It would be there, full bars, for about a minute and then be gone, no service at all, for about two. It was, unfortunately, completely unusable.For Japan, it's a 5/5. No connectivity issues, it's been strong everywhere, works great.Averaged out, that's a 3/5. Do not use in southeast Asia, use without concern in Japan.

For the most part, very good. Easy to set up and use. There was a day in the middle of my usage where it just refused to connect; the website gave an error when I tried to contact them for help. However, in the evening it started working again and worked fine for the rest of the time I needed it, so I don't know what went wrong.
No real person to talk to in order to guide you when the setup is not working. It took days to get the esim activated. Very frustrating. The coverage wasn't awesome but it was decent.

Review.Titre: The overall network speed was terrible
Review.Contenu: The overall network speed was terrible, even though I had 5G
In London was easy for me to connect, while going to Brasil it is not connecting at all

Review.Titre: Problematic activation, app useless, no overview
Review.Contenu: One you activate the service, it’s fine, but the activation was painful. The app is pretty much useless, comparing to other ones, here is no overview of how much data you already used.

Very good prices for unusual or far away locations. Easy to understand data packages and plans with quick payment activation. Few downsides: The app would not always sign in automatically even if on Ubigi network with active data plan. The data consumption in the app is not accurate - my connection stopped during the videocall even if the app still showed 114MB left.

Review.Titre: Muy fácil de activar y de llevar…
Review.Contenu: Muy fácil de activar y de llevar control del consumo. La cobertura podría mejorar. En algunas zonas no tenia cobertura cuando con otra tarjeta del país sí.I've tried to send you a message but I've got the message: "There was an error trying to send your message. Please try again later."

Coverage is disappointing, when there is a signal, data works well, but unfortunately on the Isle of Wight, coverage seems to be little better than my other provider. Installing the e sim was straight forward. So good in that respect and price is reasonable. I was hoping that being a different network my data coverage would be improved, but does not appear to have much better coverage than O2 on the IOW at least.

When it switches from 5G to LTE in Tokyo you loose connection and either need to put the phone (iphone) in airplane mode or disable 5G and only use LTE, this happens to all of us in our group that is using Ubigi

Review.Titre: Coverage and signal strength good but…
Review.Contenu: Coverage and signal strength good but overpriced and not enough data per package. Service/platform is asking for too much money and giving too little in a time of extreme connectivity and high volume video calling. Packages should offer more.

Review.Titre: Poor or slow connection in some areas
Review.Contenu: 1. Unstable or very slow reception in some areas of Paris - metro stair entrances and indoors. 2. YouTube instructions are outdated - please update to current format to avoid confusion.3. Explain why there is 1+ GB data consumption even before landing in Paris ?

Review.Titre: No reception in Page & Grand Canyon
Review.Contenu: In general, i like Ubigi because of the affordable price and good quality. I used it in Hong Kong, Japan and Taiwan, the reception was good. This time I used it in Phoenix, Page and Flagstaff aera, the reception was minimal. Grand Canyon area has no reception at all!

Review.Titre: better than T-Mobile but not great
Review.Contenu: This was better than T-Mobile,  but it still was spotty in terms of connection and speed (in Japan); despite saying I had perfect reception all the time.  The app was helpful to install. I will try someone else next time.I was all over Tokyo Osaka and Kyoto. The slow speeds were in all 3 cities so it is not “oh you were in a bad area”  type thing.

eSim (Tokyo) was easy to install etc. however signal kept dropping out.or not connecting at all. Had to switch phone to flight mode regularly to restart mobile connection. Unsure which telco Ubigi use but 5G was slow (when it worked). I’ve had faster 4G when home in Australia. Would’ve thought 5G in Tokyo would be super fast and reliable- not the case. Disappointing and frustrating for the amount of money paid.

Review.Titre: Data was fine ok in Tokyo, however……
Review.Contenu: Data was fine in the general Tokyo area, however I completely lost connectivity once I traveled to Osaka. Ubigi was visible on my screen as well as LTE and 5G alternatively the entire time I was there, however I completely lost connection. I followed the instructions offered on the app (when my phone would connect) and nothing worked. I am now in need of data and connectivity for my last three days here in Tokyo. I’m not sure how to proceed. I’ve used a competitor’s app in Thailand without any issues. Unfortunately, reviews of that app in Japan left questions. Anyway, this was my experience with Ubigi.

I have used a rental wi-fi router several times before. esim from Ubigi was very easy to set up and connect.  It was very comfortable to go everywhere without extra battery and a router.   However, the connection speed was not high enough (probably because of roaming). Compared with a Wi-fi router using DOCOMO signal, it was very slow.  I expected more. Yahoo Japan did not allow to access, although it is not a your problem.  If 5G can be used, it would be better.

When it comes to price and flexibility, Ubigi is definitely your choice! The only problem I have is the internet speed when traveling in japan. I'm getting almost 3G or slow 4G speed most of the times even though the signal shows 5G. If the speed is your priority then better to find another service. Otherwise go for it.

I bought Asia 1G three times.Travelled Japan-Singapore(transit)-Mumbai-Singapore(July 14)-Japan.On July14 I could not use internet at all.Only when wi-fi is available,I could use internet. I was really in trouble.The carrier was M1.I sent request to ubigi, and got useless reply. With no improvement,I can not travel only with ubigi,I need backup wi-fi router.Please solve the problem.

Review.Titre: Ubigi worked quite well in Japan
Review.Contenu: Ubigi worked quite well in Japan using Google maps to get around.The initial set up was pretty straight forward although I could have used a bit more clear instructions on turning off my primary number in a wifi area in order to make Ubigi the only cellular connection.  Once I figured this out it all worked well.

Review.Titre: Used this in the centre of Tokyo, inconsistent and slow
Review.Contenu: Used this in the centre of Tokyo and the data was very slow, and extremely inconsistent. Websites and google maps would just stop refreshing out of nowhere. Comparatively to Korean esims, Ubigi was nowhere near consistent or as fast.Although one plus is the connection was easy.

1. Could not connect initially because the APN information was incorrect. According to FAQ the value should be "mbb". Needed to find a public wifi and dig into FAQ to know about the above "trick" WITHOUT internet connection from Ubigi. 2. Connection in Barcelona is painfully slow (only 3G). Because of this, only 4GB was used out of 10GB purchased in 1 week. The rest was wasted.

Review.Titre: Was a fairly easy set up but it took 3…
Review.Contenu: Was a fairly easy set up but it took 3 days to properly work, even though it showed I had signal 5g or lte nothing was actually downloading. The 1g I had went thru in 4 days & I wasn’t even streaming anything. Wondering if it was continually trying to connect & hence using up all the data. I even put on airplane mode when I knew I was out of range.

Review.Titre: Good eSim for traveling in Japan, South Korea.
Review.Contenu: Easy to use, good speed most of the time. good rate in Japan, South Korea but very expensive in Thailand.

Review.Titre: Coverage is very bad in London.
Review.Contenu: Coverage is very bad in London.I was at tourist location most time and having choppy connection. No service once enter tube station, and totally disconnected underground. Even at shopping district like Bond street and Oxford street, no service once I enter the building.

Review.Titre: I used Ubigi on my trip to Japan and it…
Review.Contenu: I used Ubigi on my trip to Japan and it occasionally dropped service on my phone, about 2 times every day. I had to reconnect my esim every time this happens. My friend also had Ubigi on her phone and after midway into her trip it started disconnecting too. When it did connect it was very fast, but it was unreliable.
It was easy enough to set up but hard to see how much data you are using as you go. Mine also seemed to run out almost suspiciously quickly.

The convenience of landing at the airport and turning on high speed data is fantastic. Not having to deal with buying, mailing, and returning SIM cards is much appreciated. However, the signal could be stronger. At the back of convenience stores, I often had weak signal, and this is within Yamanote Line areas.

Review.Titre: very easy to use and the best way to…
Review.Contenu: very easy to use and the best way to obtain roaming at a reasonable price all over the world.  Unfortunately, there is very possibilities to interact with Ubigi if a problem or doubt arise.  No chat or whatsapp, only possible com is sending an email that is rarely responded

Review.Titre: It's very difficult to manage the Ubigi…
Review.Contenu: It's very difficult to manage the Ubigi account. I have just sold my car and cannot see how to cancel the plan :(

Review.Titre: Two eSIM active in the same time.
Review.Contenu: Using Ubigi it is not possible to have two eSIM cards active at the same time. Mobile application is not moderns and in some cases you need to refresh few times main screen to check current state. Rest of is good, works fine.

Service and coverage feel overall average.  The ux was decent except I couldn’t log out of my mother in laws account for some reason.That said, being able to have data outside of roaming is a MUST, and the fact that this made it possible is accomplishment on its own~

Coverage was inconsistent, sometimes good sometimes poor even in the big cities. At times the my phone showed 5G service but web browsing was super slow and froze. Other times browsing was fast and worked fine. I used the data mainly for navigation and occasionally directions did not update until I moved to another area. Perhaps service would be more consistent if they had agreements with more than one carrier and could switch dynamically to the best available signal?

Review.Titre: There was a day in Frankfurt where I…
Review.Contenu: There was a day in Frankfurt where I couldn't connect to Ubigi all day.

Review.Titre: Not knowing the price before activation…
Review.Contenu: Not knowing the price before activation was a real downer.  If you're competitive, then just publish ahead of time.

Review.Titre: Good cellular service, bad customer service
Review.Contenu: The cellular service usually works ok, but the customer service is unresponsive. And yes, I checked my junk folder.

Review.Titre: Your signal is weak in England
Review.Contenu: Your signal is weak in England. In particular, we couldn't have a lot of times that receiving signal in buildings.

Review.Titre: Your server denied payments and show…
Review.Contenu: Your server denied payments and show error message for almost two days. I originally thought it was credit card company’s problem and even called them. But it turns out it’s your problem. It made me nervous wondering if I would be out of network in a foreign country.
It would get 5 stars if service had not gone out for several hours one day. There was no way to contact support, receive assistance, troubleshoot, or know how long the service would be out.

Review.Titre: Good for data but no calls
Review.Contenu: worked well to an extent (data) but could not find a way to have connection to physical sim and e-sim at the same time so could not get calls if I needed data. Using I-phone 12 Pro but could not find solution in FAQs although problem was discussed. Still not sure if it was phone or user error.

Review.Titre: The connection was unstable in Japan
Review.Contenu: The connection was unstable in Japan. Sometimes I had Internet, sometimes I didn't. Especially in crowded places like airports, it wasn't reliable.
I thought that I would be able to make calls as well, but that option was not available.  The signal was intermittent in Nevada USA and in the end, I stopped using it. I will not buy a new plan.

Review.Titre: Unsure if drop in signal was due to…
Review.Contenu: Unsure if drop in signal was due to place or the telco?

Cons:The instructions for setting and activating the esim are confusing. The video instructions on the website are also very outdated.Pros: once esim is up and working , speed is fast and pricing of plans is very competitive

Review.Titre: The network went off often during our…
Review.Contenu: The network went off often during our trip of 18 days. It annoyed the most when we were driving and using google map.

Everything worked well on arrival, but on my last day I lost total connection to the service. I was not out of data yet, but could not reconnect back to the network. Thankfully I was in a metropolitan area and was able to connect to the wifi then I activated my physical sim and paid the daily international fee.

Review.Titre: Connection in japan was not that good…
Review.Contenu: Connection in japan was not that good always. Sometimes I had to even restart my phone to get mobile data working. The previous time in japan I was using My Truphone service, which was working perfectly. I will go for Truphone next time also.

Service worked in most places adequately, but in Vietnam it was very very expensive for just so so data (wasn't that fast). Worked well in Japan. Wish it worked better for the price we paid in Vietnam.

Review.Titre: In the first 2 days it was not in…
Review.Contenu: In the first 2 days it was not in function . Bad covering som places! Overall ok when funcioning.

Review.Titre: The internet connection is good but sometimes gets lost.
Review.Contenu: There were some instances when there is no internet connection when I need it the most during my stay abroad. But overall, it's still a good experience. I'd still use ubigi again in my next travel~.  Hopefully the it will improve more in the future.

It was incredibly difficult to set up ubigi via my phone - the installation process for the eSim hung over and over again - even restarting the phone (android) did not help. In the end, I was able to install with the additional help of a laptop. Not a positive use experience (in contrast the airalo eSim is much easier to install)

I went to Japaqn using Ubigi. I was quite nervous about relying on an Esim, but Once it was set up it was fine around Tokyo, Mount Fuji area, Kyoto and Hiroshima. However once I got to the Osaka area I had very patchy and then no connection and it became very frustrating.I paid £13 for 10Gb for 30 days. I used about 7Gb in total My wife took another option and bought 2 Japanese SIM cards which cost £15 each for 1 week each, (to make sure one of us had a signal. She didnt have a connectivity issue)  so clearly a big cost difference.I would use them again

Review.Titre: The how to use instructions could be…
Review.Contenu: The how to use instructions could be clearer

Review.Titre: One 30-day 10GB passes wasted, one recovered with Ubigi assistance
Review.Contenu: I bought two 30-day 10GB passes for $24 each (total $48) but had trouble installing the pass for my wife.  Because I could not get any customer service, I ended up deleting both eSIMs and gave up.  Complete waste of $48 because of zero customer service.  Regardless of directions and videos, some customers will have a problem.  You need to provide a service for them too.Addendum:  Ubigi sent email soon after my review first posted, and they corresponded repeatedly until both eSIMs were recovered and connected to the data plans I had purchased.  Hence my rating is changed from 1 to 3 stars.It is 3, not 4 or higher, because my wife’s data plan is still not 100%.  While it works and she is clearly using some Ubigi data as intended, somehow our primary cell plan is still getting data requests and therefore charging us $10/day for international data.  Perhaps this is our mistake in how the phone is set up, nonetheless it totally defeats the purpose of buying an additional data plan as offered by Ubigi (and competitors).

Review.Titre: The idea and the concept are really…
Review.Contenu: The idea and the concept are really useful and innovative but the pricing is still on the higher end, I'm waiting for a day when the price of esim will be around the same (if not lower!) of the classic sim cards.
Not enough GB at a reasonable rate.  I would have been better off buying a local SIM card

The app didn’t work … didn’t show how much was left.Ubigi has just contacted me to tell me I can do what I was doing everyday - which was checking the info on 'my data plans'. This shows that I have 8.92 Gb left on one and 3 Gb  left on the top up. Oh yes, forgot to mention, I topped up because I no longer had any data remaining. For one-off data plans the app does not work. Simple.

Went to Las Vegas and honestly it was really spotty where as my friend was on the AT&T and the reception was good. Used it in the UK and it was pretty good so I think it is a hit and miss depending which carrier Ubigi uses in that area.

Review.Titre: Sometimes it doesn’t work as expected
Review.Contenu: There are areas where this network does not work properly so I had to use another SIM card from ATT or Verizon.
Hard to setup, not a simple way like airalo.Also connection is sometimes lost for no reason.

Review.Titre: Did not always work in some remote…
Review.Contenu: In New Zealand it did not always work in some remote areas. Speeds were not as fast as my home mobile data. Reasonably reliable and faster than free wifi when I could get it.

Review.Titre: I had to buy it a second time before it…
Review.Contenu: I had to buy it a second time before it worked. The initial interface is not intrusive please stay with one way to create an account not three.

Pros : It worked wonderfully while I traveled  to Japan. Plans were affordable Cons : 4 Stars because the set up process was not exactly the same as shown on website instructional video. I was really unsure about whether it would work or notFortunately it did work when I arrived in my hotel and had solid Wi-Fi to finish up and activate the data plans. Overall it was a good experience using Ubigi

Worked perfectly fine and was easy to activate. Only 4* though, because Ubigi lacks the option to buy an eSIM in advance and activate it at a later date. I’m more of the cautious kind so I prefer to buy an eSIM at 1 or 2 days before my travels, just in case something goes wrong and I need to contact customer service or even switch to a different eSIM provider. But because the eSIM activates immediately I lose those 1-2 days of the usage period.Hope they’ll add in such a feature in the future.
Never had an issue with reception and the speed was generally great (compared to others that were using different services). The app tended to be a bit slow in updating available/used data.

Review.Titre: It jumps around the location of the…
Review.Contenu: It jumps around the location of the service (London, Eng., then Delaware) which causes me to be blocked from my office system at times.

Generally great experience using ubigi in Japan. However, there are two times in my seven-day trip when I need to restart esim to receive signal. One of them is in a subway station, the other time is walking on the street in Shinjuku using hotspot.

Review.Titre: Ease of data services on iPhone
Review.Contenu: Satisfaction with the ease of using data services on my iPhone and appreciate respond quickly with my refund request.

Made me connected during my travel in Japan. No need to search local esim providers for each travel. There was no IPv6 connectivity, so I have to use VPN to reach IPv6 only internet. There was a bug, then notebook say "Connected, no internet" that confused me, later discovered internet working. Overall functional service, but there are some to improve.

Review.Titre: getting a phone number to make domestic calls
Review.Contenu: The service is great and signal strength is good as well. I had some minor connectivity problems after updating to my second plan since I stayed for over a month. Also an option to get a domestic phone number would be great since making calls locally is a great plus. Also some apps would not let you register unless you enter a domestic phone number.Overall I am quite pleased with the service and the simplicity of the service.

Very good speeds and coverage especially compared to other times I have traveled to Japan and have used a tourist SIM. There were however several times where I didn’t know if I had data remaining or not. I tried to reset my phone in order for the data to work and had limited success with that.I would like to see a plan where you get X GB of high speed data and then unlimited throttled data in Japan or plans that last 7,14,21,28 days and are competitive with what tourist other SIM offerings are available. It sucks running out of data and are now unable to navigate without data and topping up at this point makes no sense.

Review.Titre: Easy set-up. Good coverage. Low speed
Review.Contenu: E sim option makes it easy to set it up at the upon landing itself. Good coverage in Fuji five lakes area, Kyoto, and Tokyo. Speed is quite slow and it's nearly impossible to browse the internet in congested areas, which is many temples, shrines, and popular railway stations.
Data would cut out occasionally. It would also be nice if it came with a temporary number.

Review.Titre: Very useful but could be better
Review.Contenu: Bought 1 month "Americas" service for a trip to Guatemala. 4G data worked well in popular tourist areas, but outside those it was 2G at best. However, locals were clearly able to stream music over 4G nearly everywhere on their phones, so it seems that Ubigi do not have good enough roaming agreements in that country.

Everything worked directly upon arrival..Coverage was great, but at some points it could’ve been better. For example, my friend using a different provider had coverage while I didn’t.. but did happen only once or twice.. would use it again!

Review.Titre: Ubiji was easy to use but App install was slow..
Review.Contenu: Ubiji was easy to use once App was installed. Good prices and package options.However Installing the App was a slow process.
Pretty good though sometimes the WiFi cut out at inopportune moments (when lost and trying to use Google maps!).  However, not easy to install - took a lot of guessing (have a Google pixel 7a).
Service was good almost everywhere. The only time the signal was weak was when I was at Tokyo Disneyland.

Review.Titre: It works for the most part but sometime…
Review.Contenu: It works for the most part but sometime it is very very slow for LTE and I am in the city in a busy district.

Provided me with enough stability of speed and connectivity throughout Japan and most indoor locations. Thank you. Would have been better if the data remains available for small and slow speed usage such as messaging even after going over the quota, for emergencies.

Service was fantastic! Easy to use and very affordable. Would definitely recommend to friends.One note would be that it seems the email marketing kicks in immediately on sign-up and proceeds to hit customer inboxes what feels like 2-3 times per week. Recommend chilling out on the email campaigns for new customers - it's spammy, takes away from the streamlined experience of the app and customer UX, and straight up just feels a bit archaic.
Easy to set up. But there were a number of times where I had to hand off navigation to another person in our group because the signal was poor.

Good but not perfect, as I had no service in Hakone, Japan. Maybe I should have known better because it’s a mountainous town, and not a big city. If you’re going to a more popular area, like Tokyo and Kyoto, then Ubigi will work just fine. If you’re going to the countryside or mountains, service may not work. Other than Hakone, Ubigi was great!

I had good speed during my whole trip! The only problem I had was learning how to turn on Ubigi when I got to my trip country and not sure what to turn off for my iPhone data to still allow imessages. I recommend Ubigi give specific step my steps with pictures when people first sign up on Ubigi. The current instructions you have were ok but too generic and was unclear how to specifically keep iMessage working. Other then that, I recommend Ubigi!

Review.Titre: Great for most of my Japan trip
Review.Contenu: Was really great for most of my trip spanning all of Japan.  However, when I got to Kanazawa, the service became slow and unreliable.  Would have been 5 stars if not for Kanazawa.
Everything perfect besides when connection stopped and I could not confirm from the app that the data were finished. Bought some more credit and connection restarted.

Review.Titre: Very affordable pricing Plans with fast…
Review.Contenu: Very affordable pricing Plans with fast internet speed. The only signal down times I had while traveling in Japan was when the speedy train passing through tunnels and some odd locations in the suburban areas.

Straightforward with clear instructions on how to use. Sometimes connection is a little choppy, but not sure if it was due to Ubigi or the local telco connection being choppy across the board. When it worked (which was most of the time, connection was fast. Would recommend for usage in Japan (was used in Osaka, Tokyo and Kyoto).

Not sure why you suggest 4* is 'not good'. But I refuse to give 5* if the experience is not perfect.Actually we were very happy to discover Ubigi when visiting Japan and China. In general the experience was helpful and positive. Just one criticism. It is frustrating to run out of data just before you leave the country and have to pay for further data, much of which will be wasted.
I had trouble getting started. Once I had paid for the app I thought that’s it. I followed instructions but could not get going.  The instructions were confusing
