I would rate this a 4.5 stars. Connection was great. Connected most of the time while in Tokyo and Chiba. Although at high density area (eg. Disneyland), the connection sometimes get slow and loading the pages takes more than 10~15 secs, I'm guessing this might relate more to the network provider itself. Overall it is still a great experiece getting connected once the plan landed and I would definitely use your service again.

Great reception all over Japan. The eSim works great. However there was no warning that we had used our 10GB of data 2weeks into our 3 week holiday. You can however see your Sim data usage. Easy to top up with the app
It worked great, but my directions in Google Maps came out in Japanese. We couldn’t figure out how to change it. So couldn’t use my phone to navigate anything too complicated.

Data plan was cheap but effective for Japan. The speed wasn't incredible, but I didn't need it to be. The plan was easy to activate and top up, with coverage everywhere I went. The only thing I wish I knew was that this esim would not give me a phone number and I would not be able to text and call. This would have been really useful to know.

Review.Titre: Connectivity in Japan excellent, minor bugs in app
Review.Contenu: Connectivity in Japan excellent. Only issue is with the app.. on Pixel 7 at least it always rotates 90° on start-up and cannot be rotated after that. So if you start it in portrait it changes to landscape which is just annoying but more importantly, you can't buy plans as payment pop-up doesn't scroll. Work-around is to start it in landscape.

Review.Titre: everything is pretty good on the japan…
Review.Contenu: everything is pretty good on the japan roaming side of things, but your app needs to improve, especially for login and payment methods.  u need to give us google login or the option of using password manager selection, also google pay is needed for making payments (don't want to save my credit card on your app).

good connectivity. 5g in most areas, but rough in crowded areas. only complaint - as my plan was winding down, it felt like speed was throttled. i would prefer it not do that so i can start my next plan sooner.

I wish the app allow me to purchase the eSim plan ahead of time before my trip & just simple activated it when you are at the destination. I don’t like the fact that the the plan active right the way upon purchase.

Review.Titre: Worked okay. Communication with ubigi should be improved.
Review.Contenu: In Korea, Busan & Ulsan. Experience was okay. Suddenly lost all connections for an entire day. Inactivating and reactivating the sim made it work for 30 sec, then connection got lost again. Tried to contact Ubigi to no avail. Poor communication.Connection came back the next day and worked well.

Quick, immediate, easy! :)I didn’t see a button / field where you could choose when the data plan should be activated. That would be nice. In France, my phone often showed „LTE“ but the download rate was extremely low nevertheless. Probably not your fault, though.

Review.Titre: Internet was available in a lot of…
Review.Contenu: Internet was available in a lot of areas, however, if it was not a major city (I.e. Nara) there would be a bit of struggle to obtain good internet. Within city centre was decent. However, still not strong enough to play co-op games without disconnecting at times.
Ubigi was super easy to use, my only nitpick is that when my data runs out, it would be nice to get a notification or see it in the home page of the app
Overall great use. Took a little bit of time to actually set up but it worked decent. There were some periods of time where it is extremely slow or doesn't connect but otherwise can be trusted.

Review.Titre: Better than data packages from home.
Review.Contenu: Very easy to buy data packages and (when you have a phone with eSIM), very easy installation of the eSIM. Price for 3GB data package in Japan was reasonable ($8), especially when comparing to data packages my service provider offers. Only slight downside was the speed not being higher than LTE speeds (which very well might not be Ubigi's fault).

Ubigi was the highest recommended esim from my online research. Esim worked great but not perfect, as there were a few areas in Japan where I had no internet randomly.Only other negative was that I found setup to be very troublesome as the website was barely working on the day I tried purchasing the esim - instead I had to purchase through the app.Overall - would definitely recommend but try to purchase the esim before you travel and then you can activate it overseas.

Relatively easy to use with YouTube videos (would prefer a printable PDF).  Seamless functionality.  The only thing that would make it better is instructions on how to be sure that your provider will not consider you to be roaming

Pretty straightforward and fast process for getting started. (Except for needing to scan a QR code - hard to do if you only have one device). Occasional data dropouts during the trip, and it would have been good to have more warning when getting close to using up data. Otherwise a painless and affordable option when traveling.

Works very well in Japan, forget the antique ”pocket wifi” devices! Minus one star because one evening we got a notification and email that all of the plan data was used, and data traffic did not work. Purchased another plan in the morning, and then the original plan reappeared! Will seek refund for the extra plan.

Generally, having Ubigi was nice to have although there were some dead spots (this was in Japan).  However, as a backup we also used the roaming service from our normal carrier which was, in some situations, more reliable.

Renewal process was reasonably simple although being told the username was already in use was confusing.  I know it was because I set up at the outset. Otherwise the system works well for allowing vehicle updates & for using the maps for navigation but otherwise having WiFi in a car is for us, of little benefit

Review.Titre: We found the price was reasonable, but set up was challenging
Review.Contenu: We found the price was reasonable. Once we got it working we were happy with its functionality.  We scored it high because of that The set up was not well designed and the video did not explain it well.  My husband and I installed it on the same evening and we got different screens requesting different demographic info.  If we had not had the help of our computer savy son we probably would not have persevered. Thank you.

Cost to performance is great. In japan though you do run into a few hiccups in service when going in and out of buildings or using the trains/subway compared normal cell service. Just takes a few moments to reconnect or locate you.Overall it's a great service though with very little lasting connection issues.The installation process could be a bit smoother on Android. I'm sure in time they will make this much better.

Review.Titre: Had some issues getting this installed…
Review.Contenu: Had some issues getting this installed and working at the Narita airport. On Android. I know it is not easy to keep track of all variants of Android UI's, but you really need to have a rock solid set of instructions that I don't have to guess in order to make it work. If I try 3 times, I know that is already too many times for any of my relatives and friends, and they will give up.

Overall pretty good. Very easy setup with a USA iPhone 11. Signal was probably good 90% of the time with decent speeds. Google maps loaded relatively fast, photos of map places loaded kind of slowly. GPS with this was terrible though. Overall, still ok for the price.

When we first landed it almost seemed like the sim card wasn't working.  I didn't know how to troubleshoot as there wasn't much info on that when I looked it up before I traveled. But it quickly resolved on its own as I was leaving the airport.

e-sim not working after arriving in Japan. Try to resolve problem locally.  After 2 days of trying, called Ubigi Customer Service for assistance. Customer Service will look into it.  Service Representative Vincent sent email with instructions with possible solution.  Advised Customer Service that problem still existed after trying their instructions to it.  2 days later, Ubigi solved problem remotely with new account.  e-sim service available after 5 1/2 days without service.

This was a seamless experience and made my trip much easier and smoother with access to internet. Connection was patchy in some spots (eg underground) but it was super useful. Was also glad I didn't have to lug around a portable wifi! Would recommend to friends and reuse in the future!

Fast respons.Not 5 stars because I was logged out autumaticly and could not logon again. I could also not change my password as the link either came not through, or so much later that I had already logged off
Easy to add esimEasy to monitor data usageReliable data streamReasonable pricing

First time with e-sim.  It was easy to download and set up with the instructions provided. Coverage was good most everywhere but could be a bit spotty in buildings. Helpful to have Google maps for getting around, used Messenger for communicating so much cheaper than using around Canadian providers roaming service.
Some spots in Osaka/Kyoto, the data takes awhile to load. Coverage in crowded stations in Osaka is not as good

Review.Titre: Fine trade off between speed and convenience
Review.Contenu: The internet connection in Japan was fine, not as fast as a pocket wifi but it's a trade off for convenience. A bigger issue is the inaccuracy/slow update of GPS location, which could be a minor pain if you are a tourist and use map apps often
I have had good experience with using Ubigi in my car. However there are sections of countries where I do not get full coverage particularly France

Review.Titre: The good and not so good
Review.Contenu: The good: Great value, and connectivity is, for the most part, excellent.The "easy to improve": Creating an account, buying a plan, and activating a plan: Documentation and online help/tutorials is poor. It would be great if you could buy the plan a few days ahead of time, and activate on a specific date/time.The "not sure if Ubigi can fix this": After travel through regions of spotty coverage, it takes a long time (as in hours, or a couple of phone restarts) for the phone to "see" cellular data. I had the phone claim "no signal" in Yokohama and in Tokyo, and after going into airplane mode and back to regular mode, have 4 or 5 bars of 5G coverage. After a bit over 24 hrs, the coverage was consistent again with no dropouts, even in the subways.

Review.Titre: Do using Expenses was pretty okay 👍
Review.Contenu: Do using Expenses was pretty okay 👍 It’s pretty convenient and comfortable the only bad point is the price for how many gigabytes you can have . Pretty expensive service.In Japan you offer 50 GIGA for 60€ We can have a pocket wifi unlimited for 40€ The comfort offer by the e-sim cannot outperform the price difference.I use it because of the referral who’s offer me 50% off but if I cannot have it again, it’s gone be probably the last time.

Review.Titre: Very good coverage and speed even in rural areas
Review.Contenu: Good coverage, anytime. Very good speed also in rural areas. Five stars if Ubigi provides a Widget with near realtime display of remaining quota.

Review.Titre: Easy Setup! Prices are in USD
Review.Contenu: Setup was easy and have had very few problems while being overseas. Only complaint I can think of is the lack of information regarding the plans being in USD. Doesn't say anywhere that the costs are all in USD until you’re about to pay.

I'm satisfied with Ubigi.It wasn't always super intuitive to use, but it's no fault of their own. I was not familiar with the concept of eSim and having primary and secondary providers on my phone.I had a bit of trouble getting a good connection here and there. Often when I wasn't above ground, or when I just landed after a flight, I couldn't connect.

Used Ubigi in Japan, buying data was simple. The only real issued I had was that connection was as times slow and you could lose reception in the strangest places. I should be able to walk into a restaurant and till have reception.It's a good and convinient service, but they might want to have a word with their owners Docomo about the coverage.

Review.Titre: Good value for the money but some limits
Review.Contenu: Good value for the money, but with an EU and UK package I struggled to get a connection in some places (particularly Scotland). This happened most happen inside, but my brother has full connection using another esim company. Found it worked well in Paris and London though.

Review.Titre: Not the easiest web site to follow to…
Review.Contenu: Not the easiest web site to follow to re-new Other than that very happy with your product

I used this eSIM in Japan, overall the data worked well, the speed was satisfactory, the data was used mostly for googlemaps and some browsing.I recommend to my friends, some of them have some issues.

Review.Titre: Goid service, shame about rating manipulation
Review.Contenu: I would have given you 5 stars but am extremely annoyed at you “guidance for rating” (you state 1 or 2 stars =bad 3-4 stars = not goof and 5 stars = god or perfect) What rubbish - that is just trying to get lots if 5 star ratings if folk are at all happy with your service. Normal ratings are :- 1 = awful 2=bad 3= average 4= good abd 5= excellent. So although the service was actually very good I will not give a 5 star as you are attempting to influence the ratings in an incorrect manner . So sad
eSim option was great, it worked as soon as I arrived in Japan. The only downfall is some places the reception is not that good but overall it was great.

Review.Titre: Worked when I needed it with decent speeds. Can purchase more data offline
Review.Contenu: Used Ubigi for esim around japan. Worked great with the 3gb option. After finishing 3gb which I used over a week and a bit, I got 1gb more. This is where it was problematic. Either my own use or a glitch, but that 1 go was used up within 2/3rds of a day. Same use behaviour throughout the trip

Overall good, however clearer instructions, inc visuals or video, on how to set up and choose mobile data would be great as there is a fear if being charged international roaming charges by home-country provider.

Sign up process was very straightforward, it took a while to connect initially but after that the service was pretty good. There were a couple times I had to toggle airplane mode to reconnect to the network, but not sure if that was Ubigi's fault or that the network was locally overloaded.

Review.Titre: The cheapest cell phone package you will find in Europe! magnificent!
Review.Contenu: Excellent service, I discovered it quite by surprise through someone I met on the street in Paris who recommended you to me! I used it for a whole week and it was really fine, sometimes there were disconnections for a few minutes and the internet was a bit slow and that's why I dropped a star in the rating, but it was really for a few moments and in certain areas only, most of the time the reception quality was fine, apart from that everything was good and the cheapest price I found in France ! The 10 GB package was definitely enough for me for a week. Your customer service also helped me very quickly when I needed it

Review.Titre: Initial experience good, however difficulty with the second e-SIM
Review.Contenu: Some difficulty on initial activation with Italian e-SIM but fuss-free once I reached Italy.  Unfortunately the Singapore e-SIM was a different experience for the four days I was there.  Some days it would be available and other days not.

Review.Titre: Quick set up for overseas use
Review.Contenu: Pretty glad to have found this app, set up was easy as considering I was able to set up and internet connection while in the immigration line at the airport to get my passport stamped. Super easy to get going with the esim method. Only thing that could be improved is if there was a little more choice of data/countries/timing packages but otherwise this will be my go-to for overseas connections for data 😀

Review.Titre: I have connection most of the time in…
Review.Contenu: I have connection most of the time in japan.
Setup was somewhat challenging directly from the web, but after a few tries I was able to get the android app working. Once setup, it worked great. 👍👍
The simple process of activating it! It worked great for the most part, only issue is sometimes the package doesn't work for a few minutes.

First time using esim for our first trip in Japan. Easy installs, works on the new OnePlus 11 5G. I had some issues in some areas in Tokyo and in Kyoto where there was no signal but for a few minutes. The app is straightforward, tells you how many Data is left. Definitely recommend it for your trip in Japan.
Once set-up was completed properly, really easy to add esims for international destinations and top-up, when needed.Will definitely use again!

The data is good, does well and is fast. Only thing I wish for in the future are more flexible data plan options. I’m currently traveling in Japan and the data range was 10GB to 50GB. I ended up getting the 50GB because 10GB was too little but the next size up was the 50. Wish there was a middle ground.

Review.Titre: one load good one load missing
Review.Contenu: I loaded for me and my husband. I was able to use my load. but my husband's load did not reflect in his cellphone.He kept getting in his app " no load".the load we paid disappeared even after getting the Qr code.sim used in japan.i suggest there are CLEAR ABD SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONS WHAT TO DO IF LOAD IS NOT RECEIVED this is our 2nd time using in japan. 1st time both phones received our load. this time only one phone received the load

Review.Titre: Easy to access and update my…
Review.Contenu: Easy to access and update my subscription.Renewal costs are reasonable so a 12 monthly plan will give me a new option next year as data prices are falling.

Service provided was exactly as expected. Activation and setup was relatively easy. While it would have been good to have all relevant information, such as FAQs and config setup info provided together or all in one place, I had no issues with the service while on holidays after I had completed the setup.

Would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the misleading web site instructions on how to buy and install an eSIM (ignore them and install the app first, then buy from within the app). eSIM works perfectly in Japan with excellent coverage and speeds. Customer service was on the ball and fixed my SIM issue in less than 20 minutes, so that was a good experience.

It's been really really good. Good reception almost everywhere in Japan -- better than I have back home. I do have two suggestions for improvement. First, there should be a message when you're close to the end of your data (not after). It just stopped for me and I wasn't sure if it was the end of my purchase or an issue. And for setup I'd have liked a full best practices step-by-step on the website. I hit a few steps that were a bit unclear between the app setup and my phone settings. But I have already been recommending the service to others and I'd DEFINITELY use them again now that I have it set up.
Service itself is great, no issues with reception. However, I sent an email to customer service 2 weeks ago and did not hear back

Review.Titre: I got the 10Gb/30 day japan esim
Review.Contenu: I got the 10Gb/30 day japan esim, worked great with 5G speeds in tokyo, speed test had 682D/43U Mbps, i used as tethered hotspot, but kinda spotty in Narita airport.  , great for google translate and google maps

Mostly worked without any problems (in Japan). Couple of instances happened when the connection was lost and I was left without the Internet for few minutes. Set up process took a while but you only have to do it once so not a massive downside.

I was confused with how to buy a plan. Website said you need to scan a QR code to activate the plan. I bought the plan via the app and didn’t get a QR code.Moreover, the plan was activated immediately. I was planing to buy it in advance.I emailed CS and they extended the deadline.
Very useful in Japan, worked every where with no issues…had a problem with top up though.Hard to get any support.

Review.Titre: Ease of use and cover most locations.
Review.Contenu: Ease of use and cover most locations.Edit response after received reply.Would get the fifth star if not lost reception at a few crucial moment.

Review.Titre: Data was reliable but only LTE
Review.Contenu: Data was reliable and available everywhere I went to in Japan. My only issue was that I was limited to only LTE on my Pixel 7 Pro. My friend who was on iPhone was able to retrieve 5G using Ubigi throughout our trip.If this is fixed I will definitely be using Ubigi again in the future for my travels!Thank you!

Review.Titre: Was really amazing to have this new way…easy way to travel
Review.Contenu: Was really amazing to have this new way of travelling, especially as South Africans. We would in the pst have to buy a SIM card for the country we would be visiting. Just a pity it wasn’t part of the package in Norway.

Review.Titre: Useful while hiking and camping in the Japanese Alps!
Review.Contenu: Ubigi served me well while I was hiking and camping in Kamikochi, the Japanese Alps. Mostly reliable and satisfied with the service. Will use it again for future travels!
pretty easy to use, and the connectivity was also okay.  A few places, the connection was weak.  Make sure and load the app on your phone before you leave home because there are a few steps to that.

Incredibly smooth and frustration free compared to international SIM plans from years past. Highly recommended for travel in Japan. Worked well for me in Tokyo, Hakodate, Morioka, and Sendai. Sendai was the most difficult but that region is very crowded with buildings that any network will struggle.

Review.Titre: Super easy setup - will use for all future trips!
Review.Contenu: Super easy to setup and get an eSIM for use in Japan. Was able to add the eSIM before leaving for trip and phone connected right away upon leaving airplane. App was easy to use and monitor data usage as well as buy more data when needed. Very affordable with great speeds across all Japan.

Review.Titre: Ubigi for travel on Okinawa island
Review.Contenu: I used Ubigi for data connection in Okinawa from 14-21 Dec 2023. The quality of the connection was excellent and I had no issue with it at all. The experience was much better than with another eSIM provider previously. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who plans to travel to Okinawa.

Review.Titre: Choosing Ubigi was the best decision…
Review.Contenu: Choosing Ubigi was the best decision for my trip! It is super easy to use and it is one fee and no hidden fees. So much better than my US carrier. I would recommend highly. Something to note, you need to have an unlocked phone, so if you are on payment plan with your local carrier, you will not be able to use the eSIM.

Very reliable but I unfortunately ran out of data near the end of my trip to Japan. I only blame myself for that and it was very easy to top my plan off for the duration of my trip once I found some wi-fi.

Review.Titre: Affordable, reliable, and easy to use
Review.Contenu: I had never used an eSIM before and it was very simple and worked great during my trip to Japan. I so enjoyed not having to carry a pocket WiFi around this time around! The data speeds were consistent and reasonably fast. Not quite as quick as back home but I was able to use map navigation and browse Google without any connectivity issues, even outside of Tokyo. The pricing is also very reasonable. Will definitely use again.
Esim activation was easy.  Just set Ubigi as the primary sim at your destination.   Service has been reliable everywhere in Tokyo so far.
The internet worked really well throughout Japan, did not have any issues setting it up or getting it activated. Would recommend it to anyone traveling through Japan

This service was not only user friendly but had wonderful service abroad! I went all over Japan from Tokyo to Osaka and never had to worry about cell reception. Not only was coverage great but way cheaper compared to competitors.
I had a problem affecting the SIM card in my Range Rover, and in fairness to Ubigi support they were superb in sorting it out.. Excellent communication and back up service..
Really great experience.It is super fast, easy to use and the price a really decent if you are travelling. I highly recommend it.

Review.Titre: It was so easy to set up and internet and…
Review.Contenu: Was so easy to set up and internet and messaging is flawless. They resolve any issues quickly. Would definitely use them again for international travel!
Connectivity was good and installation was fuss free. Has a very good rate for Japan plan. Thanks!

As a first time user, I had a lot of concerns with overseas data plans. I’m not tech savvy so Ubigi’s simple to follow instructions helped me greatly. My 15 days in Japan was just fabulous without any problems.
Works perfectly, great price and amazing discounts for future purchases , love it! 😍
Extremely easy setup. Connection is almost flawless. And prices are really reasonable.

Review.Titre: Ubigi saved my vacation in Japan
Review.Contenu: The physical SIM I bought for my Japan vacation (I have an unlocked, bought in USA, Google Pixel 8 Pro smartphone) worked poorly. It connected to 4G and then dropped after 10 min, requiring me to manually reconnect each time I wanted to use the internet. That basically make the physical SIM unusable.The Ubigi eSIM saved the day; it worked smoothly and fast in Japan on my phone. Ubigi gave me a reliable 4G data plan. Ubigi was also priced fairly. I will use it going forward and recommended it on Reddit.

excellent service, very amazing LTE in Japan. I'm coming from the US and used to very fast internet on my phone all the time. I had no problem with Ubigi. I also got a 50gb package and used internet (social media, posting videos, sending photos and videos in messengers to friends) every single day for 10 days and only used up about 10 gb surprisingly lol. So didn't need the entire 50 gb. But if you're using it for hot spot and other video intensive work you may need that much data! Food for thought.

I heard of Ubigi from a YouTube video, and I compared it to another eSIM company. I ended up choosing Ubigi and set it up while I was still in the US. I activated my 30-day plan the day before I left. I was staying less than 30 days, so it didn't matter that I was not in Japan at the time. Ubigi was running perfectly when I got to Narita airport, and I was ready to go while my traveling companions were still figuring out their physical SIM cards and portable wifi devices. I ended up running out of my initially chosen plan, 3 GB, and I ended up buying 10GB. It was money well spent. Thank you for the complete service, and I am pretty sure I had service nearly everywhere I went in Japan, including some more rural areas. I never ran into any issues where I would need customer service, so I cannot comment on that.

Lifesaver! I purchased the 10 GB data for Japan for about a week and a half and it was more than enough. I think I had about 2GB left after the trip. It worked in most areas of Osaka, Kyoto, and Tokyo. Saved me from purchasing a pocket WIFI, which I found to cost significantly more than I'd like. I plan to use this in future travel tips definitely. Thank you!!
Never had any trouble with speed or connection. Totally recommend it.

Review.Titre: Easy to use - will use again
Review.Contenu: Found this a very easy service easy to use. Quite a straight forward procedure to install the e-sim. Good price for the service and never found myself without service - always had a connection when I needed it. Will use again. I had over 50% of my data left and my partner stayed in Japan for another week - I would have liked to be able to give the remaining usage to her to use - but don't think there's an option for this.
Stable WiFi 95% of the timeUser friendly instructions Very competitive pricing
Sim setup was a little confusing, but that was done before I left. Once I was on holiday the recharge was super simple and service was perfect.

I rated 5 star because of the connection quality and value for money, I had 5G in South Korea it worked great.I like that the App is simple to use but on Android I wish it could support a password manager when logging in via WIFI to make logging in easier. It's the only app that asks me to enter my username and password manually.

Review.Titre: Very convenient so you don’t need to…
Review.Contenu: Very convenient so you don’t need to switch out physical sims all the time and you can use it in multiple counties

Coming from the States, the infrastructure in Japan is amazing. Except for obvious things like going through a tunnel and certain parts of the subway system, the connection and speed is outstanding. I stayed 2 weeks and bought the 10gigs. I ended up doubling it. Device: Pixel 7.
Amazing service, costumer experience is great. App is a bit rough around the edges, but works fine.
Great coverage throughout 5countries i've been in europe. Fast speed as well. Cheaper than buying a simcard if only requirind mobile data
I was in hospital for 6 days and used Ubigi service to access news, YouTube, email and texts family and friends. Never had a problem. Always had data. Will use again in future.
Highly recommend Ubigi! I've used it while traveling in both Japan and South Korea and I've had great coverage throughout and haven't experienced any issues.

Review.Titre: The installation was a bit confusing at…
Review.Contenu: The installation was a bit confusing at first but once it’s completed I like the fact that I can add more minutes to it as needed using the app. The network was fine the majority of the time in Japan, some dead zone but I think it’s just the nature of cell network. Overall I’m happy with Ubigi and plan to use it whenever I’m abroad.

Review.Titre: Really enjoy using Ubigi for seamless…
Review.Contenu: Really enjoy using Ubigi for seamless coverage back and forth between Canada and US. Also plan on using this in very near future for UK and EU coverage. Can’t say enough good things about this company.

Review.Titre: Easy to use and track my data usage
